bow: what do you wish you had known before having children ve been asked this lot by friends after had lo always say wish had known how unbelievably hard it was going to be and to get as much help as possible from family members what do you wish you had know before having your first how about second third kids did realize how much would love it was super convinced about motherhood but ve really loved it it also been lot easier than thought it would be my husband helps good bit he takes two nights week so can catch up on sleep so that might be part of the reason why also things get rapidly easier after the first few weeks will say that most everyone agrees that we have pretty chill baby for my first wish had known that what seemed to be wonderful support system would completely disappear once the baby was born it hard to go from what seems like everyone being invested and helping to nothing pregnant with my second 17+5 we re super excited and this time nobody cares at all it very isolating do get to see my boy doing something new or getting better every day love being able to spend my days with him wished had known to worry less about labor and diapers and more about postpartum sleep deprivation also my partner and should have discussed our expectations about each of our parenting roles more we re in good place now but it was big adjustment for us wish had known that loving my kid would rip my heart out and make me feel so emotionally raw it terrifying to be so vulnerable and love him as much as do ve read the quote about how having child is like living with your heart outside your body for the rest of your life and it so true knew the logistics of parenting would be hard manging sleep changing schedules money daycare etc but had no idea it would emotionally impact me so much after the first year finally felt like was just surviving and maintaining pretty well we re coming up on birthday in october and just now feeling like personally growing as me again never realized it would take so long to find myself again after having kid just wanted to say hi because expecting on 19 and have son already too hear ya on the support system bad at asking for help and want to try harder this time around because in hindsight wonder if people just did know how to help because was specific wish had understood how messy breastfeeding was going to be and that just because you breastfeed it does necessarily mean your baby is going to come to you for comfort everything else feel fine with having learned it as went also breastfeeding does not guarantee your kid will get sick less daycare =sick for full months on the flip side breastfeeding has seriously been one of the best experiences and accomplishments of my life 9mo pp and wondering when get to be me again thanks yes to this comment had no idea how many times be struck with stark anxiety about how much have to nurture and protect this wonderful being in my life from harm it nerve wracking removed same here month pp feel like complete shell of who was before got pregnant dont even remember what it was like to care for myself did really think about help from family members and it was for year or so it finally clicked how much help most other women had there was barely woman knew who did get the grandparents doing some childcare at least days week in the first year the only time even had babysitter was when had to have root canal and the neighbour looked after her for couple of hours in retrospect it was crazy should have realised needed more support and family members should have been more pushy in offering it if they were available to this may also have been because all my relatives and thousands of miles away and my mother was already dead have also noticed that maternal relatives *tend to* of course not always but as broad observation play larger role than paternal ones far more women used their own mothers for childcare rather than their mothers in law wish would have known would have breast cancer and took moment to enjoy breastfeeding cuddles more ve heard that second child can be anti climactic in some ways people are less excited and there is that sense of *first* this can even be between families one of my best friends has toddler who is objectively very sweet and easy child and the grandparents dote on his older cousin but are almost indifferent to him and the grandparents have always been easy and lovely people so have no damn clue why this is happening stayed with him and saw it with my own eyes and was devastated for my friend he and his wife are so hurt and bewildered hope it adjusts as the kids get older wish had known that steel nipples and tanned leather breasts would have been good thing to pre install removed when finally started some self care again around the one year mark simple things like shaving my legs plucking my eyebrows getting my hair cut going to play movie with friend reading book for fun was shocked at how much really was taking care of myself did shave my legs for an entire winter and my skin was so dry that actually developed mild rash on my shins that had for months and did even notice it so sad and feel gross about it now but at the time taking care of my body in any way just was on my priority list it gets better am finally excited about my future again and starting new things on my own but it did take long time to get here also my son is named noah too lt wish had known that carrying and birthing my son would result in chronic irreparable coccyx pain mean it would have mattered but that was not in the fine print that you may not like who they are when they reach adulthood go few weeks without shaving even now in the hot florida summer just hope people dont notice my hairy legs and when they get bad enough just wear leggings my poor husband lol christmas trees in august wish would have known how fast it flies by also wish would learned patience prior to having children this story time if you re bored everyone was so excited for our first and my mom was planning to stay with us for up to week after he was born she decided to stay with my sister who lived in the same city and our first day night out of the hospital they went shopping and out to hockey game the next day my mom came over to help which consisted of eating potato chips on the couch and watching tv did change diaper and only held our son long enough to take pictures while he was sleeping we called my mil who had offered to help but was giving my mom who lived hours away chance to bond she came that day started doing laundry helping around the house and helping me so my husband could go back to work my mom came back from shopping with my sister saw my mil there and walked out without saying word did speak to me for weeks and had my whole family mad me for upsetting her we started talking again probably months later but still not over it lo is almost with our second my parents came to visit the weekend after he was born but she did come to his baptism due to conflict with quilt show she was attending now that we are hours days from having our third do know if she and my dad are even planning on coming to visit and honestly it would be easier for us if they did how heavy the responsibility feels to be responsible for someone else 24 discussing expectations is huge and *how* to have an argument when expectations are met premarital counseling was really good for that actually how much my spouse would mentally check out and he the one who wanted kids sooner than did pretty much everything that everyone else has said plus the grieving of my previous life now gone who was is forever in the past and what am become is completely unknown isolation in regards to minimal support externally that there is difference between post part um depression and burnout from being overloaded how to my battles more wisely edit formatting that my awareness of mortality and how temporary life is would explode and hit me like truck daily also how amazing little people are wish know wtf lip tie was amp that my insurance actively avoids it amp if you want it dealt with you need to put pressure on your pediatrician amp if it not dealt with your baby will have poor latch amp you will not be able to keep up with supply amp you will feel like failure with sore nipples everything is going to be sticky floors walls light switches door knobs the kids the cat your shoes they get it everywhere how does this happen how the hell is there jelly on the ceiling clorox wipes in bulk gt that there is difference between post part um depression and burnout from being overloaded yeah struggling with this right now my son was born in december last year and things were really smooth sailing mood wise for about months since ve been off for the summer it has been steady down hill husband thinks need to touch base with doc about pp mood disorders and agree that should talk to someone but feel like the more obvious explanation is that legitimately unhappy because of concrete things you know biggest fear of mine is my lo growing up and not like me as person mean do really like my mom dunno why we just ca click or talk hope would have much better relationships with my own daughter removed wish known that not being able to breast feed did mean was failure it truly does matter how baby is fed things wish known the first weeks or so are grace period before the sleep deprivation kicks in you re riding on rush of endorphins good will positive attention helping hands and parental leave and you feel almost invincible when the bottom drops out it drops out hard you are expected to be on 24 people lose interest work resumes and the baby needs are relentless it wears you down quickly be prepared stagger leave so return to work is abrupt and schedule visits as far out as you can if people offer to come help try to get them to come from weeks 10 when you ll really be crying your eyes out with exhaustion hire help around the house if you can breastfeeding hurts like hell **even when you re doing everything right** for the first week or so until your nipples desensitize they will be raw and agonizingly sensitive no matter how good your positioning or the baby latch nothing made me more pissed off than so called breastfeeding resources that refused to admit that breastfeeding pain especially early on is normal edit to clarify many resources say breastfeeding is not painful period if it hurts check for improper latch position thrush mastitis here bunch of information about latch position thrush mastitis and nothing at all about normal nipple pain because breastfeeding done properly is never ever painful that it understand that they want to minimize fear of bf ing and to encourage vigilance about latch issues but it creates needless sense of failure or fear for women who are otherwise doing fine check in with your doctor ped and or lc regularly but please keep in mind that it does frickin hurt in the beginning you need community of parents this goes double if you re stay at home parent was completely on my own at home for the first four months thought was going to lose it had bad ppa ppd that was compounded my loneliness and isolation have some social anxiety but had to power through and start attending mother groups and baby classes made friends had routine got out of the house and had things to look forward to it made me feel so much better and my son thrived too you will eventually feel 100 like yourself again and it is glorious when got pregnant everything started changing so fast and so drastically that mourned that grounded sense of self that taken for granted thought it was gone forever but just like many other parenting related challenges it happily temporary your life will never be the same but you can reclaim your sense of identity as an autonomous person for me it happened about year out when my son started regularly sleeping through the night and improved even more after weaned at 17 months probably lot to do with hormones help it along do neglect your physical or emotional health set some personal goals that have nothing to do with parenting and take as much time as you can to just be alone or with your partner this is one of my biggest fears too what was your relationship like with your mum beforehand postpartum depression can sneak up on you and bring you down without you realizing or recognizing what happening until you have the worst thoughts and getting help is not seen as failure as parent lot of the help that people offer is for them to come over and hold the baby then leave be specific about expectations for visitors also got terrified of anyone who did get tdap for me shaving is like cleaning the house only do it when have someone to impress just want to say that restarting self care is choice if you force yourself to get back in the habit again you will and this is what helped me most to feel like my own person again felt like me again around the month mark because chose to start caring for myself again everyone is different every kid is different but my kid is going to die if she has to be in her play pen for half an hour while put on makeup or shave my legs etc nothing am glad did know what did know because might have not had baby it good idea ve gone twice since the girls were born just out of curiosity you said you ve been off for the summer as in you went from working to being sahm for couple of months the first time let my parents take my son for the week end it was like realized had been holding my breath for weeks and hardly thinking about myself or anything but the baby at all also mine about to turn and still have to train myself not to let my mind go down the path of what if something awful happens to him do have any kind of research behind this but could one part of the maternal vs paternal relatives be because sons tend to move farther away from their families use my mom all the time for help but that because she 15 minutes away and my mil is hours totally agree on both counts watching my sister go through massive sleep deprivation that lead to depression and mismatched expectations leading to divorce my spouse and did basic training for labor but we dedicated lot of focus and strategy towards sleep and maintaining our relationship happy to say that months pp we re doing pretty good removed ve heard it trend from demographer that women tend to repatriate to their country of origin when they have child this was in the context of uk aus couples or uk couples in aus and vice versa guess it makes sense that maternal relatives play larger role after all women still do the bulk of childcare and in most cases you be closer to your own relatives than your partner knew about the sleep deprivation but really did know anything thought it would be like the movies oh the baby is crying in the middle of the night yawn guess have to wake up for minutes nope we had to set alarms and get up to feed her and she wanted to sleep through every feeding so it was at least 90 minutes each time way more difficult than thought it would be that really sucks sorry you have to deal with that honestly it their loss sounds like you have good relationship with your mil so at least there that it helped me realize how much my mother screwed me over and sadly it took having kids to realize that ve been teaching myself to be mom and teach myself lifeskills while being mom meaning did have good mother role model and she did teach me anything full time grad student took winter off with baby went back spring and at the time it seemed wise to take summer off so that could get some baby time and my husband could get smooth start to his rotations but staying at home has never been my thing and losing my marbles or have ppd or just generally cranky and unpleasant exactly thought knew about sleepless nights but had no idea same with spousal roles we did talk about it but we were so naive to what it would be like to have colicky screamy reflux baby that our pre baby talks were just irrelevant hope so he going to notice this time around not telling anyone much more so do get hopeful my mums my bio mum and foster mum were the same as yours never really wanted to be bothered refusing to change any diaper even if it was just pee they offer to babysit to be fair but with the warning that they leave him in whatever mess he happened to make what is really strange is that for my side of the family this was the first grandchild understood hubby parents not really caring they already had two from the favoured son there definitely strange sad sort of relief that they are going to be involved this time though my choice so glad you had hubby mother support in those early floundering days is so important and it takes so much time to take care of yourself barely wear makeup do style my hair my clothes do need any special care like hand washing or ironing and yet caring for myself seems to take forever had no idea before had baby now resent the mins it takes to pluck my eyebrows remember that support system disappearing on us too the silver lining has been that some people who were were all that close to before we had baby we are now closer with not sure how or why it happened but it awesome that it did overall say we ve come out pretty well removed also formula feeding does mean your kid will have zero immune system my elder son only got small amount of breast milk for about 10 days and he remarkably healthy he had few minor colds sniffles and right now has mild case of hand foot and mouth disease but otherwise nothing he 27 months old and has been in daycare since 11 months old felt like such badass last night because managed to get the baby back to sleep in 40 minutes might have bragged about it to hubby this morning sounds like you tend to be an extrovert know not good at being cooped up and less good at not having variety of conversations and new stimulation ve been trying to find ways to get my dose of outside life with the babies in tow such as going on walks to local shopping places or hanging at my old cafe here and there it tough challenge brining supplies at first but after week of it you turn pro do have to be careful though because one baby is an introvert and the other is anot extrovert so try to mix it up for both of them they seem to really love our daily outings too and for some reason think we ve been socialized to think that babies should be put in bubble when they are born and life seems to stop for new parents sleep dep aside one of the few on the flip side would let my own mother so much as hold my boys even if my arms had been violently ripped off my mil is the sweetest most amazing woman and the only person who has babysat for us since birth and they both live in the same town as me wish you could feel the pain of when you child is screaming and crying before you have on so that you never tell another parent its fine or its not big deal when they are crying because their child has been yelling at them each night when they are tired but refuse to go to sleep there were so many night where just sat down in the hall and sobbed while my daughter told me she hated me or was mean and that she needed me when she really just needed sleep and so did my siblings each had child in the last year and they didnt understand what was trying to say before they had baby and had few nights like that they said some hurtful things to me when was going through it and im sure said similar things to other people before had my daughter it hard my daughter is my whole world yes it blows my mind that every single choice make impacts someone else life mean kind of got that with my husband but most of the time he does care like dying my hair my husband has no opinion but my year old daughter started to think her hair was ugly because everyone told her thats what my hair is supposed to look like but ve always been dying it lots of different colors have never said my hair was ugly in her lifetime but that was the impression she got it is insane oh man those nights are the best the only time in life when an extra 45 minutes of sleep feels like winning the freaking lottery you have skill if you got in and out in 40 minutes this makes me feel better due to my job had zero maternity leave so had to go back after weeks my supply was very weak and cried almost every day over the breastfeeding struggle feeling like was failing my daughter since we mostly had to supplement finally decided to completely stop breastfeeding at months because the stress and the crippling resentment felt toward my job was good for me or anyone really have worried what not getting that good breastmilk for at least months would do for her immune system so it nice to hear positive side thank you removed wish had known the importance of finding good reliable baby sitter it funny wish known more about the possibility of this not happening because it did still has really for me and my daughter is almost so much just had my 2nd child 10 days old and while it hard all over again do have to make that fundamental adjustment since did it two years ago with my older son pretty mediocre she was bad mom by any means she just let my dad be my go to parent growing up so we never got to be as close as her and my sister she threw some tantrums during my wedding about year earlier too mostly just do think she ever really liked who am as person she is rockstar mil wish would have known how terrible stories on the news about kids being hurt assaulted would affect me so much before having my son would just think ya know wow that messed up or that sad but now literally get sick to my stomach when hear of these terrible stories and have broken down crying multiple times still can not watch the news and my son is removed as unfortunate as it is sometimes the best thing you can do for yourself and your kids is to have no expectations of others sorry to hear that your moms are so underwhelming on the grandma front too you re welcome if you re feeding and loving your baby then you re doing your job as mom ca imagine the stress in going back to work weeks postpartum do be so hard on yourself ve got 2nd baby now 10 days old and trying my best to breastfeed but he was weeks premature and does have the energy to feed the way he should if he does pick us his energy levels soon we ll have to go exclusively to formula glad ve got proof of happy healthy formula fed kid in my older son momming is hard we need to give ourselves break sometimes removed was really hoping for the same do nothing right even when helping it not good enough or not enough it really sucks and that they wo know to appreciate it for few decades eh work focused introvert but the social isolation is definitely component we are very active baby loves people and stimuli but going out every day to play group or to hang out with family just is replacement for work apparently wish had known that going in stories like that make me want to call my mom and thank her again for how helpful she was when my baby was born have never even heard of real life grown person let alone one who has taken care of kids before refusing to change diapers mind boggling wish had known how much happier feel and how much nicer am to everyone when avoid alcohol entirely was only drinks night kind of gal when my son was born to his other mother might add but it turns out those drinks were sucking away lot of energy and patience and replacing them with anxiety and shorter temper gave up drinking on whim when he was just over and it has been hard to realize how much easier the first two years would have been if had done it before mine was exclusively breastfed went to daycare got the colds needed tubes which were lifesaver and 1000 worth it have an older sister like this so it interesting for me to hear of other people dealing with family doing similar stuff my sis demands to be the most important person in my life but acts in way that means do particularly even want her around me that much she recently thrown tantrum and stopped talking to me because do treat her like do friends and family this was only three months after had baby and have really had time for *anyone* her version of helping me when need support is to say she not getting enough attention then cutting me out it the first time ve truly seen how crazy she is sorry you have mum the same know that you re not alone in having some crappy family yes my friend put it perfectly once you are parent every child is your child ca stomach hearing about anything that has happened to children anymore even if it something fictional on tv show have to nope right out of there wish had known truly how difficult transitioning from to kids would be was not prepared at all and some days not sure we would have had 2nd child had we known what we were in for at least now we are 100 certain there will not be 3rd this is my fear too when found out it was girl my first thought was hope she likes me have great relationship with my mom so guess just hope have great relationship with my daughter too that makes sense are you able to do some sort of part time work study in order to fulfill that need lot of these posts are kind of on the negative side of things but actually had the opposite experience was surprised at how easy everything was those first few months granted realize very very lucky just was expecting to be one of the lucky ones after reading so much advice about how bad things can be maybe that lowered my expectations just enough birth was smooth and straightforward recovery was fine she never cries unless she needs something and it super easy to figure out what that is diaper boob or sleep we got plenty of sleep broken sleep but plenty of it she took to breastfeeding well and we never had any issues with it we had tons of visitors early on but they were great my house stayed clean because baby loved the carrier and had nothing else to do while on maternity leave lost most of the baby weight by the time went back to work our daycare is nice on the cheaper side and my daughter seems to like it guess wish had known to expect the worst but realize your experience may not be that bad at all it an adjustment for sure even easy babies are hard but for us the adjustment has been an easy one what sorts of things thinking of having 2nd sometime in the next year or so deleted as parents we have gone from always being able to take turns tag out to always being on the evenings are exhausting my month old gets cranky and over stimulated as any infant would that time of day but it coincides with when my year old is getting home from school banging and yelling as any year old would so one of us spends the whole evening feeding and getting the baby to finally sleep and the other parent feeds our toddler dinner bathes her and fights getting her to bed miss bedtime stories with her we still switch off but it not to take break or make dinner we finally have moment to breathe at around 9pm most nights at which point we still need to make dinner and feed ourselves our baby only gets up about once at night but my toddler is also fighting night terrors about once week and then she brings virus home from daycare for one or all of us to get it rough think part of my trouble is that our first was fairly easy chill baby my second is not at all he is just demanding little dude know it gets easier but we are struggling right now had no idea what we were in for what are your strategies if you do mind me asking those areas would be my two key concerns too how long it actually takes to heal after childbirth wow felt like had been hit by bus for weeks yeah everyone is always saying oh what can we do to help and then no one ever does my mom was great bringing food for couple days but after that felt like was interrupting her life when had to ask for help mine made my son birth about her and even tried to give an ultimatum about his name argh oh geez ll never understand why people think the name of someone else child is any of their business sure ll break my answer into two to address each area with the sleep dep we agreed to work in shifts until ethan was sleeping decent amount my hubby is night owl and morning person we determined we both needed at least hours of continuous sleep to be functional so we broke the 12 hour period between 8pm and 8am into two hour shifts taught myself to go to sleep very early like 8pm and my husband would have the night shift till 2am then take the monitor and he would sleep from 7am during this time we slept in separate rooms knowing that this was temporary setup that would allow us to both get enough sleep obviously this is harder if you re breastfeeding but had decent stash of pumped milk that allowed us to do this until we switched to formula we also kept strict bedtime and routine for little man know this does work for every baby but it worked for us 8pm pajamas diaper massage bedtime story and milk we also from very early on put him in bed drowsy but awake occasionally he would cry so we pick him up until he calmed down then put him back in the crib sometimes we had to do this over and over but he eventually figured it out it can be exhausting but you re helping your baby learn good sleeping habits so it worth it also after seeing how it affected my sister and bff said no bed sharing ever no matter how tempting it looks at the time it led them both down the path to over year of sleep deprivation and less than ideal sleeping habits for their babies so our little guy was in his own bassinet or crib from day again know this does work for everyone but this was hard line we drew these were our strategies they wo work for everyone and every baby but we talked about it lot beforehand to make sure we had plan ll address the relationship stuff in second post cause it more complicated lol do have good relationship with my mom do think ever going to leave my kid alone with her the kids would survive but she awful yells swears borders on neglectful and emotionally abusive my nephews are practicality traumatized from when she watched them my mil on the other hand complain about her lot but she wonderful do you think it was harder to transition from to kid or from to kids just had my first and it usually not too bad but definitely want to have more in my opinion it definitely depends on the natural disposition of each child we got lucky with our first and she is just more laid back kid joke that she tricked us into having second our baby is lot more demanding than she ever was and we have raising toddler thrown in the mix it probably also depends on your lifestyle pre kids we had mellowed out lot as couple and become very family oriented before our first was born so the staying home taking her into account with all our plans was too hard of an adjustment for us hey thanks for taking the time to reply it sounds worthwhile to have solidly planned strategy for all aspects of sleep we will have to think about this carefully in advance like the idea of shifts tho it bit complicated for me as have epilepsy and have been advised not to be alone with baby so we could do him off me on but sure there are ways to work it out for the same reason would have the baby in bed with me as could have seizure so it would be safe do know how but like to encourage baby to soothe themself my sister has got in loop now with her toddler where if she wakes in the night she screams and wo go back without hours of being held and bounced and only then with an adult lying down in the room beside the cot do know if my niece is just harder than some babies or if my sister interventions are feeding the problem not that want to blame her she doing what she thinks is best yah that what so hard know every kid is so different and what worked well for ethan might not work at all for other kids know other women who bedshare and it awesome for everyone but like you terrified of accidentally developing bad sleep habit and then being stuck for weeks or months holding or rocking baby toddler to sleep do function well with less than continuous hours so that just sounds nightmarish for me the epilepsy does throw an extra complication in like you said it really about making sure that you and your partner think and talk through your strategy more so than adhering to any particular tactic or school of thought good luck to you wish would have known my plan for returning to work and career was completely unreasonable worked as an attorney for the state legislature and was supposed to go back to work at the beginning of our session where worked crazy hours often till 10pm or later my whole plan was to go back to work do daycare find nanny to pick up baby and spend the evenings with her my husband was in medical residency and had crazy hours too do know why thought this would all work and did understand how difficult it would be to transition from maternity leave to never seeing my month old ended up quitting my job few weeks before going back and think it also caught my employer off guard our off season at work is the standard 4:30 with lots of time off so wish just would have found solution to get through january march busy season with my employer and not have to quit loved my job and miss it very much but still do know how it could have worked with spouse who also works very demanding hours without hiring lots of help removed
